text: I think I'm sitting next to a cat inside of a hull RIGHT  NOW!

text: Wow. Sitting in front of your computer. A cat pulls up in hull... totally creepy.

name: krispykorn
text: A comment left by krispykorn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Carlyle, ZombieJesus, dismas, Ariamaki, Wimble, waldo913, Gumfish, Lokiamis)

name: plummet
text:
your lames suggest that Assetbarbarians do not enjoy being addressed as crackers

CRACKERS

name: soticoto
text:
Oooh... Assetbarbarians. I like that term.
Chubb.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: The hull is, as you can tell, Samuel L. Jackson's character from Coming to America .

name: catachresis
text: Aah. I always thought it was George Clinton.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: It reminds me of the Red Meat guy. The shading is very reminiscent.

name: salo
text:
Now that you mentioned it... Yeah. Especially that time when he shaved his head.
[IMGS OFF]

name: meetzorp
text: Bug-eyed Earl!

name: mercuri0us
text: Damn that's funny out of context.

name: fosters
text: Damn, really? I always found this way funnier when I thought it was just a random guy.

name: ravindra108
text:
I don't know. I'm not really seeing that.
[IMGS OFF]

name: hannah
text: ray was doing tai chi in sports socks? i love that cat.

name: huber
text: but he takes them off to go outside - which is kind of weird

name: hannah
text: a rad dude can't be seen outside in just a thong and sports socks i guess.

name: petitegitan
text: Socks always get way too dirty outside.  He's just being clean-sock-proactive.

name: huber
text: well you see I always imagine Ray as more of a dirty-sock-reactive man

name: hannah
text: i think, having given it due consideration, that ray is a new-socks-fresh-from-the-packet-every-day kind of a guy. it's also possible that he makes puppets out of his old ones. just like old times. :)

name: nutmeg
text: you guys are totally just talking about the dynamic between ray and socks, which is hell of rad.

name: hannah
text: it's something worth considering. also, i've given thought to how teodor manages to wash and wear that jumper so much.

name: soticoto
text: Who even said he washes it?

name: bjorntd
text: The dude's a stuffed bear. He probably gets washed.

name: soticoto
text: Who washes their stuffed bears? o_0;

name: foetus_punch
text: This dude. Right here.

name: bjorntd
text: (I do.)

name: tekende
text:
A 16-year-old and a 20-year-old both have stuffed bears and even wash them.

This is Assetbarrio.

name: foetus_punch
text:
I bust out of Achewood Manor, throwing teddies at the masses as I shout "Assetica! Assetica!"

Freshly washed teddies.

name: farqussus
text: A freshly washed teddy is a whole different thing, but worn ones go for a pretty sum on websites I know nothing about.

name: dismas
text: Look, man, if you can't have fun playin' with a stuffed bear, then it's time to reevaluate your life.  You've become jaded.

name: jonmw
text: They let athletes wear leg warmers!

name: zem
text: for some reason that guy looks like he belongs in Red Meat

name: djwhiterabbit
text: you have usurped my very same comment .

name: lateadopter
text: Always made me think of Lincoln with dreads.

name: hyetal
text: What are you talking about?  Honest Abe never had dreads.

name: splendorr
text: But in a comic, he could. That's the thing.

name: cjfoster
text: A comment left by cjfoster was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sabbac, ButterMoths, Plurabelle, Belgand, fattypneumonia, foetus_punch, unsentletter)

name: notcool
text:
Red Meat will always have a warm place in my sick lil' heart. It's the first webcomic I was ever introduced to.

That it was introduced to me by a then Boy Scout leader who may or may not have been drunk at the time, has nothing to do with it.

name: 1000hz
text:
So THIS was how "don't you lecture me cracker " got introduced into my vernacular..

It's all coming back to me.

name: hexjumper
text:
I can't figure out how they intend to use that as a disguise. If I looked over, and I saw that guy in the car next to me - complete with those staring, unblinking eyes - I would immediately think "That is just a cat wearing a costume."

Or empty my revolver in a state of pure, animal panic.

name: zedpower
text: A comment left by zedpower was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hectik, Connellingus, _cheesekayke, deathpiano, LRosetw8)

name: hexjumper
text: That's not racist. Look at the _eyes_, man. No human being can hold a facial expression like unless they've had an ice cube jammed into their brain through a nostril, and even then you'd only be able to look like that for four, five seconds.

name: splendorr
text: Every human being I see driving will immediately look away from direct eye contact. If you want to go unacknowledged by humanity, just look all strangers directly in the eye. It's better than being invisible, because your targets will not only pretend like YOU aren't there, they'll pretend like THEY aren't there either.

name: zedpower
text: I still can't tell if these lames come from people who don't understand I don't mean it, or from people who understand I don't mean it but don't find it humorous.

name: bjorntd
text: There is not sarcastic typeface on the internet. At least, no inherently sarcastic ones.

name: bjorntd
text:
SHIT. Not=NO


I QUIT.

name: atticusonline
text: [sarcastic] I hope this works [/sarcastic]

name: autrepoupee
text: if it is any consolation zedpower i got it and thought it was funny and i too have been burnt by people not getting a statement i make on the innernet (i find the easiest solution is to type in a completely non-caps manner and with minimal consideration to grammar and puncuation, people seem to understand then that you are as the bard says jockin em)

name: woodenteeth
text: Chubby!! And... oh god why have you got a revolver?! And why do you call it a Revolver! You are too familiar with this weapon!

name: onepapertiger
text: That was a fantastic thing to say. You should bow.

name: spicyponyhead
text: But only if it was open season on the freeway. Otherwise, it would just be ruuuude.

name: honesttom
text: In any case, he certainly couldn't be keeping a close eye on the road.

name: evolume
text: i'd buy a T-Shirt with this hull on it, in that pose, with Beef's tail and legs.  please, Onstad, make it so.

name: cailetshadow
text: Seconded!

name: geysershitdick
text: I probably wouldn't buy one.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: neither would i, but it would possibly become my desktop background.

name: henrythecad
text: In panel one and two, Ray is buggin' on his new socks. New socks are excellent.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Again it is Beef with the killer punchline, saving the funny!

name: dasilodavi
text: I'm not sure hw funny this is, but I just love these strips that come along once in a blue moon that take a brief moment to address that the world of Achewood really is about cats living in a human world.

name: spinynorman
text: I sort of expect that dude to start yelling at me about "de fat, oogley boddle!"

name: thatcrazycommie
text: Don't you love it when the alt text immediately answers the first question you had?

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i wish they had done more of this, it really intrigues me

though there seem to be many instances where they didn't mind just driving around, looking like cats

name: samuraieaux
text: It appears as if Ray WAS sliding around hardwood in socks in the previous strip, but his arms swing like that in other walking strips regardless.

name: cherubrocker22
text: Ok I think I'm guaranteeing some serious lamings by saying this, but I have to be honest - I don't like this strip, or any of the ones that attempt to explain the mechanics of the Achewood universe. It just straight up doesn't make sense. If they have to go to such extremes just to go outside, how do they rent apartments and own houses? The truth is, I don't care how. I care about the characters, the writing and the humor, which are all excellent. I think like any longtime reader, I'm way past worrying about the believability of robots, coke-addicted squirrels and cats hanging out.

name: fosters
text: I'm generally not a huge fan of the whole Underground bit, but this strip is one of my favorites for some reason. I just find the idea hilarious.

name: stormagnet
text:
I've got similar feelings about the whole Underground distinction, though I definitely give Onstad props for being so thorough and imaginative about it.

That hull scared the everloving piss out of me, though; for which this strip gets rated up, in my book.

name: tekende
text: I agree with you and was all about to make a very similar comment myself. I find the Underground concept distracting and unnecessary.

name: achilleselbow
text: I pretty much felt the same way for a while, then it occurred to me that perhaps the whole Underground thing is in fact an ironic parody of precisely the kind of continuity-obsessing that we're criticizing here. At least I'd prefer to look at it that way.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Hmm...but you have to admit that Onstad hasn't exactly kept some rigid, Star Trek-like adherence to these mechanics. I'm with you, I don't care about continuity and fictional integrity in this sense, but it's always seemed to me like the "Achewood universe" situation is invoked no more often than it is ignored. If it provokes his creativity on a given day, then you gotta use what you gotta use.

That's one thing I like about this comic. He was inventive enough to come up with this intriguing universe, but smart enough to know that sticking to it at all costs would probably be a hinderance to the humor.

name: splendorr
text: I like the Underground. It's not essential nor is it mentioned constantly, but it provides a smidgeon of grounding and rationale that hooks into the imagination and, I think, supports the other comics a lot more than you think. Whether that matters or not to you is, of course, your business.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Saturday - Monday)

Roast Beef: I basically got to not have any tequila
Pat: Trial Gone Awry. Jesus.
Philippe: Nothing good lasts forever...
Onstad: MISSING BALLOON - EXTREMELY SMALL REWARD

Today's Blogs

Onstad: My friend is going to wear Achewood t-shirts on television.

name: confusion
text:
Alt text: "There is no NSTL to downtown SF because of the complex subterranean human public works."

Does anyone know what "NSTL" stands for?

name: echidnaboy
text:
National Subterranean Transit Link

I find the whole Underground concept fascinating, but I'm glad Onstad's kept it in the background.

name: rabbidpanda
text: I don't think that any single sentence has made me laugh more abruptly than the last line of this comic did.  Like, zero to crying in 5 words.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Wasn't that guy in American History X?

name: redphillip
text: The concept of hulls is, for me, simultaneously brilliant and creepy.  If these things are genuinely hulls, what have they done with the original contents?

name: woodenteeth
text: Soilent Green.

name: woodenteeth
text:
...oh, no skin or legs:

Soilent Green lite .

name: theguitarhero
text: for the post-apocalyptic humanoid on the go!

name: carlyle
text:
Yikes man.

Also, I am guessing that such a person would be commonplace on either of the coasts, as I hear those places are crazy(?) and full of non-savory characters(?) but I wouldn't know becuase I live in the mid-west(I think?)
